intro: Tetracera borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean tetracera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red bracts. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Tetracera borneensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
